article: Marian Anderson was an American. She was born in 1897, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. She grew up surrounded by poverty. Yet she remembered her family as a _ one because of her parents' love. It was in church that Marian first _ to sing in public. She was six years old then. The songs were about _ and the hope for a better life after death. Her interest in music _ as she got older. When she was eight.her father brought home an old piano. But the Andersons were too _ to pay someone to teach Marian. So she was able to _ herself only a few simple songs. Her _ remained her most important musical instrument. Marian's father _ when she was ten years old. She had to go to work to help _ her family. She _ to sing at church on Sunday. Soon, other churches heard of the young girl with a beautiful, deep voice, They invited her to sing for them. Marian _ . She began singing in African-American churches all over Philadelphia. At about this time, several people told Marian that she should have a voice teacher. They told her that a beautiful voice could be destroyed _ it was not trained. Marian said she always sang _ , without any thought of how she did it. She realized that she would need some _ . The people in Marian's church were very proud of her. They wanted to help, even though many of them were as poor as the Anderson family. They _ enough money to pay for a few voice lessons. She went to a local music school in Philadelphia. Marian was a talented singer. But without those people's _ , she might not have become so successful.
